column4: Wise Road Capital buys Magnachip Semiconductor for $1.4 billion
column5: SEOUL (Reuters) - A controlling stake in South Korea-based display and power chip maker Magnachip Semiconductor Corp was sold in a take-private, all cash deal worth about $1.4 billion to Beijing-based Wise Road Capital and its partners, Magnachip said in a statement on Monday.
column6: The transaction is expected to close during the second half of 2021, subject to customary closing conditions, including the receipt of shareholder and regulatory approvals.

column4: SK Hynix eyeing part of MagnaChip Semiconductor - source
column5: SEOUL (Reuters) - South Korea’s SK Hynix Inc is looking at buying part of logic chip maker MagnaChip Semiconductor Corp, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday, adding nothing had been decided.
column6: SK Hynix, the world’s second-biggest memory chipmaker, and its bigger rival Samsung Electronics, have been beefing up development of logic chips such as mobile processors, image sensors and automotive chips, betting on their growth with memory chip demand slowing.
column7: South Korea’s Maeil Business Newspaper said on Monday that SK Hynix was considering bidding for Magnachip’s foundry business and its factory in South Korean city of Cheongju, citing chip industry sources.
column8: SK Hynix and MagnaChip declined to comment.
column9: In February, MagnaChip said it “has undertaken a strategic evaluation of the Company’s Foundry business and Fab 4,” with options including “joint ventures, strategic partnerships as well as M&A possibilities.”
column10: MagnaChip said it has retained financial and legal advisors to assist in the evaluation.
column11: Local media previously reported the businesses up for sale would be worth $300 million.
column12: The former non-memory unit of Hynix Semiconductor was bought by a consortium of Citigroup Venture Capital (CVC) in the United States, CVC Asia Pacific and another investment fund for $830 million in 2004.
column13: The South Korean company is owned by a number of investors including Brigade Capital Management, Oaktree Capital Management and Evermore Global Advisors, Refinitiv data shows.

column4: SK Hynix eyeing a stake in MagnaChip, nothing decided - source
column5: SEOUL, April 22 (Reuters) - Sk Hynix Inc is looking at buying a stake in MagnaChip Semiconductor Corp , a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday, adding nothing had been decided.
column6: South Korea’s Maeil Business Newspaper said SK Hynix was considering bidding for Magnachip’s foundry business and its factory in South Korean city of Cheongju, citing chip industry sources.
column7: SK Hynix declined to comment. (Reporting by Hyunjoo Jin)
